tags.name: Tenants
tags.description: Creating, listing, viewing, and deleting tenants for Bold BI/Bold Reports using an API can be a powerful and efficient way to manage and organize your data. The request body should be in JSON format, and you can provide the tenant information in JSON format. Include the necessary headers for the API request, such as the Content-Type and Accept headers. To create, view, update, delete, and list the Bold BI/Bold Reports tenants, use the following corresponding endpoints.

post.description:
To call the token API, you will need to make a POST request to the API endpoint, typically in the format of `https://your-domain/api/token`. 
 You will need to include the following parameters in the body of the request:

 - grant_type: client_credentials 

 - client_id: your client ID 

 - client_secret: your client secret

 You will also need to include the appropriate headers for the API, such as

 Content-Type: `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.

200.description: Successfully retrived access token.

400.description: Only grant_type=client_credentials requests are accepted by this server.

post.description: Configure the Bold BI or Bold Reports application using the REST API.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete.

400.description: Tenant id invalid.

get.description:
List all the Bold BI and Bold Reports tenants available in the application.
/v2.0/tenants returns the first 25 tenants by default.
Note:
By default, this API endpoint returns a list of 25 tenants. You can get more records (up to 100 records at a time) by using the page and page_size URI parameters. For example, refer to the following URLs:
  • /v2.0/tenants?page_size=30 returns the first 30 tenants.
  • /v2.0/tenants?page=2&page_size=30 returns the second group of 30 tenants.

URI Parameters
  • page_size the number of tenants to be returned per page.
  • page the page number.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Specify the number of tenants per page.

200.description: Operation success.

400.description: The content of the request body is missing or incomplete.

406.description: The content of the request body is invalid.

417.description: Failed to get list of tenants.

get.description:
List all the active users.
URI Parameters
  • /v2.0/users returns the first 25 users by default.
  • /v2.0/users?page_size=30 returns the first 30 users.
  • /v2.0/users?page=2&page_size=30 returns the 2nd group of 30 users.

get.description: Retrieve a list of activities performed in the item module. This endpoint allows site administrators to filter logs based on various parameters such as event category, event type, user email, tenant ID, app source, and date range.

parameters.name: eventCategory
parameters.description: Specify the category of the event. Allowed values are User, Permission, Settings.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: Specify the type of the event. Allowed values are Added, Updated, Deleted.

parameters.name: initiatedUserEmail
parameters.description: Specify the email address of the user who initiated the event.

parameters.name: targetUserEmail
parameters.description: Specify the email address of the user who was targeted by the event.

parameters.name: eventStartDate
parameters.description: Specify the UTC start date to filter logs within a specific date range. The format should be ISO 8601: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

parameters.name: eventEndDate
parameters.description: Specify the UTC end date to filter logs within a specific date range. The format should be ISO 8601: `yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ`.

200.description: The list of activity logs was retrieved successfully.

400.description: Invalid log module

Check the permission required for the database users [here](/faq/what-are-the-database-permissions-required-to-set-up-bold-bi-embedded/)

Maintenance database of the database server.

UseSiteIdentifier.description: Decides whether we need to use or ignore the site identifier. If the site identifier is ignored, unique domain should be used for each site.

UseCustomBranding.description: Decides to use branding details from ID.

CustomAttribute.description:
Custom site attributes.

is_enabled.description: Enable or disable the Isolation Code.

Password.description:
Password of the user.
Note: Password must meet the following requirements. It must contain,
  • At least 6 characters
  • 1 uppercase character
  • 1 lowercase character
  • 1 numeric character
  • 1 special character

Email.description: Email address of the user. This value may be required based on the user accounts configuration.

Password.description:
The user's password. Depending on the activation mode, this field may not be required. For, Email activation mode password is not necessary. Automatic activation is password required.
Note: Password must meet the following requirements. It must contain,
  • At least 6 characters
  • 1 uppercase character
  • 1 lowercase character
  • 1 numeric character
  • 1 special character

AccountActivationMode.description:
Specify the mode of account activation.

* 0 - AutomaticActivation
* 1 - EmailActivation

target_user_name.description: The username of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

target_display_name.description: The display name of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

initiated_user_name.description: The username of the individual who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

initiated_display_name.description: The display name of the individual who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

event-date-format.description: The formatted string representing the date and time when the event was recorded in the activity log.

initiated_user_email.description: The email address of the user who initiated the event recorded in the activity log.

target_user_email.description: The email address of the individual targeted by the event in the activity log.

event_date.description: The date and time when the event was recorded in the activity log.

event_category.description: The numerical identifier representing the category of the event recorded in the activity log.

event_type.description: The numerical identifier representing the specific type of event recorded in the activity log.

app_source.description: The source application from which the event was generated in the activity log.

app_type.description: The type of application (e.g., API, Web) from which the event was generated in the activity log.

site.description: The tenant name from which the event was generated in the activity log.

event_category_string.description: The string representation of the event category in the activity log.

event_type_string.description: The string representation of the event type in the activity log.

user_log_details.description: Details about the user activity that was logged, including the IP address and user agent.

summary.description: A brief summary or description of the activity recorded in the log.

ip_address.description: The IP address from which the activity was logged.

change_log.description: Details of the event associated with the logged activity, including any changes made.

user_agent.description: The user agent string that identifies the device and browser used during the logged activity.

ChangeLogCollection.description: A collection of change logs that detail the specific changes made during the logged event.

ChangedItem.description: The name of the item that was changed during the logged event.

ChangeLog.description: A list of specific changes that were made to the `ChangedItem` during the logged event.

ChangedItem.description: The specific item that was altered during the logged event.

From.description: The original value of the item before the change was made.

To.description: The new value of the item after the change was made.
